songBody:
Tuning: Standard (EADGBE)

[Intro] 
G C Cadd9


[Verse 1]

G          C            Cadd9
Leaves are on the ground 
G        C    Cadd9
Fall has come 
G          C         Cadd9
Blue skies turning grey 
G       C    Cadd9
Like my love 
G        C       Cadd9
I try to carry you 
G            C     Cadd9
And make you whole 
G          C     G
But it was never enough 
G                 G/Gb
I must go 


[Chorus]

    Em7  D           C                 G             G/Gb
And who     is gonna save you when I’m gone 
    Em7  D            C
And who’ll watch over you 
         G
When I’m gone? 

[Instrumental]

C Cadd9 G C Cadd9 


[Verse 2]

G           C         Cadd9
You say you care for me 
G           C    Cadd9
But hide it well 
G           C        G                    G/Gb
How can you love someone not yourself? 


[Chorus]

    Em7  D           C                 G             G/Gb
And who     is gonna save you when I’m gone 
    Em7  D            C
And who’ll watch over you 


[Instrumental]

G C Cadd9 G C Cadd9 

[Bridge] ( with electric guitar play these in barre ) 

Em7          Cadd9                    G
And when I’m gone who will break your fall 
             Dsus4
Who'll you blame? 
Em7        Cadd9               G                       Dsus4
I can’t go on let you loose it all Its more then I can take 
Em               C
Who’ll ease your pain 
          G
Ease your pain? 


[Chorus] ( with electric guitar play these in barre ) 

    Em7  D           C                 G             G/Gb
And who     is gonna save you when I’m gone 
    Em7  D            C      G            G/Gb
And who’ll watch over you 
    Em7 D               C                        G              G/Gb
And I     will give you strength when you’re not strong 
             Em       D             C
Who’ll watch over you when I’m gone away 


[End Verse]

G       C         Cadd9
Snow is on the ground 
G        C    Cadd9
Winter’s come 
G           C          Cadd9
You long to hear my voice 
G   G   G    G
But I’m long gone

This song is actually much simpler than the other ways up here. I watched some live
and the guitar player plays this song with a capo on the 3rd fret. Since the guitar is so
it’s kind of hard to tell exactly what he’s playing, so I kind of Just followed the bass 
For playing by yourself on an acoustic guitar this works perfectly.
